events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle striking a guardrail on the highway.
Based on the description, the claim was categorised under Auto Accident for further handling.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to assist the customer through the next steps.
Acknowledgement of the accident claim was sent to the customer with initial guidelines.
Documents including photos of the vehicle damage and police report were requested from the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including the police report and multiple vehicle photos.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and assessing the circumstances of the collision.
Investigation findings confirmed liability was clear and damages were consistent with the reported accident.
A settlement amount covering repair costs was proposed to the customer based on assessment results.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and praised the quick response.
After feedback, the claim was officially approved, confirming the payout to be processed soon.
The settlement payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s bank account covering all damages.
The claim was closed following payment, marking the completion of the entire claims process.
All documents and records related to the accident claim were archived for future reference.
